1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Andrei, who after his divorce moved, together with his practice, to the ground floor of a villa, receives the unexpected visit of Gheorghe Somesanu, who menaces him with a malpractice lawsuit. Andrei goes to ask for help to one of his former patients, the lawyer Ioana Cernat. But Ioana can't forgive Andrei who, many years before, stopped their therapy sessions.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Ruxandra and Tudor, the couple from the first season, bring their son, Stefan, for therapy. The boy has emotional issues, is overweight and can't adjust to school life. The boy's eating disorder appears to be stirred by the relationship with his father, which makes him feel frustrated and anxious, and by his parents' crumbling marriage.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: Dinu Damian, Andrei's new patient, is a famous theatre actor now in his 70s, accused of embezzlement and of being a former Securitate informant. Damian suffers from panic attacks but he doesn't think he needs therapy - he has come for medication. Andrei tells him that he doesn't actually need medication and that he can help him understand the causes of his pain.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Clara is a soon-to-be-married Architecture student who went in for some tests and is suspected of suffering from a serious blood disease. She needs additional tests, but she refuses to get them. She's terrified that, once the disease is confirmed, there's no going back.

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: In front of Maria's building, Andrei comes across Denisa, his big love from when he was young, who's now Maria's patient. Andrei tells Maria that Somesanu had sued him and he needs her to confirm that his therapy methods were okay. In addition, he confesses that he should have stopped Victor for getting back into the army.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: Ioana has decided to come in for therapy: her encounter with Andrei made her realize that she needs to open up about many things which hurt her and cannot be discussed with anyone but him. She feels guilty about a decision she made a long time ago and she accuses Andrei for pushing her to make that decision.

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: Andrei discovers how painful the situation at school actually is for Stefan. The boy is convinced that his parents keep fighting because he's fat, lazy and maladroit. While they are waiting for the therapy session to end, the boy's parents start fighting. Andrei is impressed by the boy's isolation.

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: Clearly troubled, Damian reads to Andrei a highly disturbing email received from Beatrice, his daughter. The man is very worried - he fears she has problems and that her friends are evil. Damian talks about another panic attack that he had and Andrei is convinced that they need to find the cause as soon as possible.

9.title: Episode #2.9
9.plot: Clara comes to therapy furious: her phone died while she was in the middle of a fight with her boyfriend. Andrei wonders whether she infuriates her boyfriend on purpose, in order to push him away and to make him call off the wedding, thus making him the one responsible for the break-up.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: Andrei tells Maria that he is increasingly more worried about the lawsuit: now, there is also the incriminatory report of the army's psychologist. Andrei asks the evaluation but when he finds out that she hasn't written it yet, he gets mad.

11.title: Episode #2.11
11.plot: Ioana has found out from Andrei's lawyer that the therapist had a fling with one of his patients. She is deeply frustrated by the fact that she never was a seductress like Nora or like her own sister, Monica. Ioana is upset that she cannot make men fall irremediably in love with her - sooner all later, they all leave her.

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: During the therapy session, Ruxandra finds out that Stefan has already met Tudor's new girlfriend, who helped him with his homework, and starts asking an endless series of questions that trouble the little boy. Andrei notices his pain, takes him to the other room and comforts him: it's not his fault that his parents are no longer together. Back into the main room, Andrei witnesses a terrible fight between Stefan's parents.

13.title: Episode #2.13
13.plot: Damian comes to therapy straight from the airport - he went to Berlin, to see Beatrice, who's hanging out with a bunch of "trash" artists and who was really shocked to see him there. Damian rented a hotel room thus hoping to "save" her, but she was very aggressive towards him. As he finally realized that she doesn't need him, he had no choice but to return home - but not before having another panic attack.

14.title: Episode #2.14
14.plot: Clara comes to therapy carrying a scale model for her final exams. Displeased with it, she breaks it in front of Andrei who tells her that her reaction reflects the way she feels about herself: the model was far from being perfect, but it needn't be destroyed. Similarly, Clara must accept her "imperfections" such as the disease.

15.title: Episode #2.15
15.plot: During his therapy session with Maria, Andrei talks about his father, now living in an old people's home, and about his childhood, spent with an always depressed mother and an egotistical father. Andrei blames his father for leaving them and praises his mother. Andrei gets increasingly angrier...

16.title: Episode #2.16
16.plot: Ioana is troubled by the fact that Alex, her friend with benefits, thinks about becoming a father but has chosen another woman as "the perfect mother".

17.title: Episode #2.17
17.plot: Ruxandra seems to have accepted Tudor's new relationship. Stefan had a great week at school and lost a few pounds. Ruxandra tells Andrei she intends to go on a short holiday but the therapist tries to make her understand that her problems are far from being over.

18.title: Episode #2.18
18.plot: Andrei finds out that Damian resigned from his job as manager of the National Theatre and that his father is seriously ill. In therapy, Damian admits to not leaving the house since he was, in fact, fired. And he doesn't want to delude himself, either: he knows all too well that he's finished. He forces Andrei to tell him whether he despises him for all the recent scandals.

19.title: Episode #2.19
19.plot: Andrei warns Clara that when someone's sick, nothing is "easy". Andrei wonders how come her mother didn't notice she lost a lot of weight, but Clara is used to being invisible. Andrei is shocked by her stubbornness - she refuses to acknowledge the fact that she is too thin - and decides to accompany her to the hospital.

20.title: Episode #2.20
20.plot: Andrei and Maria start talking about his father. Andrei admits to the fact that he's always felt betrayed by his father. He tells Maria that his mother was in a deep state of depression when her husband decided to leave her. Andrei is clearly still furious on his father's cruelty.

21.title: Episode #2.21
21.plot: After the night she spent with Alex, Ioana thinks she's pregnant. She hasn't taken a pregnancy test yet, but all the signs are there. She realizes how scared she actually is and she's yet to tell Alex. If the week before she was afraid she was never going to become a mother, now she's panicking: the pregnancy sounds worse than death.

22.title: Episode #2.22
22.plot: Tudor shows how displeased with his son he really is. Stefan is saddened and when his father starts badmouthing his absent mother, the boy goes into the other room. Left with Andrei, Tudor continues to complain about his son.

23.title: Episode #2.23
23.plot: Beatrice, Dinu Damian's 23 year old daughter, comes to Andrei. She is worried because her father is very depressed. Her mother had the idea of sending her to Andrei and Beatrice really wants to know whether her father is suffering because of her.

24.title: Episode #2.24
24.plot: Andrei is in mourning and Clara is shocked that the week before, when she phoned and asked him to accompany her to the hospital, he didn't mention his loss. Andrei tells her that it was not the right moment and that he was pleased to hear her decision to do the test. Andrei finds out that Clara was hospitalized but that she still hadn't said anything to her family.

25.title: Episode #2.25
25.plot: Andrei tells Maria that he decided to become a psychotherapist solely because he wanted to cure his childhood drama, but that he is no longer sure about anything. Maria tries to convince him that he is an excellent psychotherapist and that he shouldn't give up his job and career.

26.title: Episode #2.26
26.plot: Ioana feels sicker and sicker and she has terrible stomach pains. She is not sure whether she was pregnant or not, but she bled for a whole week. While she was sick, her mother tried to get closer to her and carry a conversation they had been postponing for the past 25 years. Andrei thinks that Ioana is finally ready to acknowledge and cure her childhood dramas.

27.title: Episode #2.27
27.plot: Stefan arrives sooner than expected - he's crying, he has no backpack and he's alone. Andrei finds out that he ran away from school: Mihnea, the school's bully, and his acolytes tormented him until he had no choice but to leave.

28.title: Episode #2.28
28.plot: Beatrice comes to therapy together with her gloomy father. She talks about Mehmet, her mentor-lover. Dinu dismisses the relationship: it's just a fling and the man is not only older, but he is also a Muslim! Beatrice is shocked by his narrow-mindedness. Dinu has a tough day.

29.title: Episode #2.29
29.plot: A much weakened Clara tells Andrei that she will never forgive him for going to her mother and telling her everything. Andrei tells her that it was a very tough decision to make - the toughest in his whole career - but he doesn't regret making it.

30.title: Episode #2.30
30.plot: Maria shows Andrei the positive report she's just written for him. Andrei tells her that he is ready to accept the decision of the committee no matter what that might be - he's still determined to give up psychotherapy.

31.title: Episode #2.31
31.plot: Ioana is exhausted - a lot of things happened recently. She's almost 40 and she's ready to accept the fact that she'll never have children. Moreover, she begins to convince herself that her frustrations are the result of social pressure and not of a real inner need.

32.title: Episode #2.32
32.plot: Rising above the resentments they harbor towards one another, Tudor and Ruxandra must make a decision concerning Stefan: is the boy going to live with his father, or will he be moving to Constanta, where his mother got a new job?

33.title: Episode #2.33
33.plot: Dinu Damian maintains that he's no longer wary and he made a decision: he is ready for intense therapy and he wants to visit Andrei more times a week. He doesn't want to aggravate his situation - he wants to solve it. Andrei is distrustful.

34.title: Episode #2.34
34.plot: Clara comes to therapy compelled by Andrei's ceaseless persistence and phone calls. She is still upset that Andrei betrayed her. She's filled with rage and she doesn't know what to do with it. Andrei thinks that the girl wants to disappear behind her rage, but she really considers giving up therapy altogether.

35.title: Episode #2.35
35.plot: Andrei's main reason for concern is his job. He feels exhausted - he's lost his patience, he's leaving out important stages, he's getting way too involved and he can't offer his patients all the time and attention they deserve.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Nora, a young and attractive doctor tells Andrei the true reasons behind her sordid sexual encounter with a stranger. Much to the psychotherapist's perplexity, the woman admits to being in love with him.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Victor is a career officer but the sternness and the stoicism he employs in his career are meant to camouflage the awful guilt he feels for taking innocent lives during a disastrous mission in Afghanistan.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Diana, a young gymnast with plaster casts applied to her arms after being hit by a car, asks Andrei for a psychological examination that could prove wrong the decision of the insurance company which had determined that her accident was suspicious and self-inflicted.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Ruxandra and Tudor, a married couple always fighting, force Andrei to take sides in a dispute that is about to ruin their marriage: should Ruxandra have an abortion, or not?

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Worried he is less and less tolerant towards his patients, Andrei goes to his former mentor, Maria, a retired psychotherapist whom he hadn't seen for the past 10 years and opens up to her, revealing the problems in his marriage.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Andrei is shocked by Nora's news regarding her boyfriend.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Victor talks about his bold return to the place of the massacre and about the problems he has with his wife.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Diana complains about her gymnastics team and her parents, and Andrei offers a startling explanation for her bitterness.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: When Tudor and Ruxandra's therapy session is cut short, Laura, Andrei's wife, makes him acknowledge the truth about their marriage.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Andrei's traumatic week prompts Maria to make a suggestion which Andrei bluntly turns down by bringing up an unpleasant event from the woman's past.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: As Nora is, yet again, late for therapy, Andrei tackles a difficult topic: are their sessions together helpful, or not?

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Victor brings unexpected news about his meeting with another of Andrei's patients. The therapist explores the similarities between Victor and his father.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Andrei analyzes the circumstances that made Diana's parents come apart and the unhealthy relationship between the girl and her coach.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: Ruxandra talks about her unexpected reaction to the miscarriage, infuriating an already suspicious Tudor.

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: Maria analyzes Andrei's relationship with Nora and tries to understand how everything began.

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: Much to Andrei's sorrow, Nora vividly describes her budding relationship with Victor.

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: Victor describes his recent erotic encounter with Nora, who questioned his manhood, and wonders if therapy can really help him.

18.title: Episode #1.18
18.plot: With the plaster casts gone, but sleepy after a night of alcohol and sex, Diana describes the events that led to her accident.

19.title: Episode #1.19
19.plot: Andrei investigates the problems and the causes which nourished Tudor and Ruxandra's hot-blooded relationship.

20.title: Episode #1.20
20.plot: Andrei and Maria, his therapist. Andrei is finally being honest to Maria about the nature of his relationship to Norah.

21.title: Episode #1.21
21.plot: A difficult situation at the hospital prompts Nora to talk about an older man she was intimate with in her youth.

22.title: Episode #1.22
22.plot: As Victor dug up crucial details of his personal life, Andrei loses his temper and his professional composure.

23.title: Episode #1.23
23.plot: Diana's mother joins her for one session and Andrei witnesses firsthand the hostility and rage that the girl feels towards her mother.

24.title: Episode #1.24
24.plot: The chaos from the week before prompts Ruxandra to make a crucial decision while Tudor makes a touching confession.

25.title: Episode #1.25
25.plot: For the first time ever, Laura joins Andrei for his therapy session with Maria.

26.title: Episode #1.26
26.plot: In order to be better understood by Nora when he tells her about the difference between reality and fantasy, Andrei reminisces about his own childhood obsession.

27.title: Episode #1.27
27.plot: Andrei apologizes for losing his temper and tries to make sense of Victor's dream.

28.title: Episode #1.28
28.plot: Diana loses her appetite when Andrei makes her acknowledge her hidden rage towards her father.

29.title: Episode #1.29
29.plot: Ruxandra and Tudor. Ruxandra considers rejecting the new and improved Tudor, with a destructive alternative. Andrei attempts at making her see in him a better man, one she could live with.

30.title: Episode #1.30
30.plot: Andrei and his wife are worried about their daughter, Alexandra, but it all turns to questions about the part that Laura plays in Andrei's life.

31.title: Episode #1.31
31.plot: Nora, who stopped coming to therapy, visits Andrei hoping that her new status will make Andrei acknowledge his feelings for her. In addition, she reminds him of their first sessions together, when Andrei acted like a dead man in desperate need of being brought back to life.

32.title: Episode #1.32
32.plot: Despite Andrei's objections, Victor insists that he is ready for the rigidity, effort and level of involvement which both his marriage and career demand from him.

33.title: Episode #1.33
33.plot: Diana confesses to Andrei that he appears in her dreams and tries to convince him that her relationship to her father is one of a kind.

34.title: Episode #1.34
34.plot: Ruxandra shocks Tudor with a childhood story and a revelation about her father's death.

35.title: Episode #1.35
35.plot: Andrei is furious that Laura and Alexandra are keeping things from him, but Maria employs a technique which proves very useful in his case.

36.title: Episode #1.36
36.plot: A tragic event reunites Nora and Andrei who have an intimate and revealing talk about parents and the way they affected their lives.

37.title: Episode #1.37
37.plot: Confronted by Victor's father, who's angry and hurt, Andrei is forced to defend his work and refuses to answer a series of crucial questions about Victor.

38.title: Episode #1.38
38.plot: Andrei tries to comfort an extremely sensitive Diana and to convince her that she no longer needs to feel guilty for her parents' mistakes.

39.title: Episode #1.39
39.plot: After visiting his parents, Tudor is convinced that his relationship with Ruxandra is more and more akin to the one between him and his father.

40.title: Episode #1.40
40.plot: Andrei's laments about the actual usefulness of therapy prepare Maria for a astonishing confession.

41.title: Episode #1.41
41.plot: Before making a crucial decision, Andrei remembers Nora's contribution to his life and the increasingly more tense and unhealthy relationship with his wife.

42.title: Episode #1.42
42.plot: Diana understands that she has to accept his father as he is and claim her independence.

43.title: Episode #1.43
43.plot: Andrei decides to move out of the house and talks with Alexandra about the way in which his problems affect her and her brother.

44.title: Episode #1.44
44.plot: After nine weeks of therapy, Tudor and Ruxandra seem to have made a decision regarding their marriage, but Andrei manages to change their minds.

45.title: Episode #1.45
45.plot: Andrei needs to face up the consequences of his actions and of his infatuation with Nora.

imdb.title: În derivã
plot: Life in it's whole "beauty" seen through the eyes of some therapyst's pacients and by himself.::Andrei Popa
synopsis:
"În derivã" focuses on one of the characteristics of modern society, psychotherapy, seen through the eyes of an A-one therapist.
The main actor Marcel Iures plays Andrei Poenaru (59), a professional and distant psychologist that faces his life`s challenge - his love for a patient. This romance will threaten everything he holds dear: his family, his self respect, his reputation and nonetheless his job.But who are Andrei Poenaru`s family?
Laura (48 years old) is Andrei`s wife, a mature woman, mother of 3 (Vlad - 9, Alexandra - 17 and Petru - 22). She feels neglected and angry for Andrei has always put his patients` interest above her and their children. She simply wants to feel loved and makes some wrong decisions concerning her marriage. She agrees to go to couple therapy to Maria (actress Tamara Cretulescu), but this will present too many unpleasant surprises for her to handle.There are also the deep, catchy stories of Andrei`s patients.There are 5 episodes a week.
MONDAYS are dedicated to Nora (30 years old), one of the patients. (Episodes no 1, 6, 11 and so on).
TUESDAYS - Victor (ep 2, 7, ...).
WEDNESDAYS - Diana (ep 3, 8, ...).
THURSDAYS - Ruxandra + Tudor (ep 4, 9, ...).
FRIDAYS are dedicated to the therapy sessions of Andrei with his own therapist, Maria. (ep 5, 10,...).
